result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Antonio Claudio-Pedraza

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($2,000.00) LW

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on November 1, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until November 7, 2022 at 1:30 PM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.  Notice is given to Defense Counsel and District Attorney.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10.24.22
Received and Filed: Attorney Nicholas Weege
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $2000.00

Defendant Luis Antonio Claudio-Pedraza not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.4.22

Remaining cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luis A Claudio-Pedraza in court. Attorney Matt Lamke appeared as a friend of the court on behalf of the defendant. Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant entered a not guilty plea to the misdemeanor count. DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/28/22 @ 1p

citations.chargeDescr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
